main event: A stationary, glowing orange-yellow object was observed in the sky near Phoenix, Arizona for approximately 35 minutes.
interesting points: The object appeared to be the size of a 'head of pin' but was 50-100 times larger than any star.
The object moved slowly at times, would stop and hover, then accelerate and move in a different direction.
The object was observed at an elevation of 22-24 degrees and a distance of 13-25 nautical miles southeast of the observer's location.
The observer used both naked eye and binoculars to observe the object.
There were no military or civilian air traffic or balloon releases reported in the area at the time of the sighting.
